df-mre
blocks.content: Define a _Moore collection_, which is a family of subsets of a base set which preserve arbitrary intersection. Elements of a Moore collection are termed _closed_; Moore collections generalize the notion of closedness from topologies ( ~ cldmre ) and vector spaces ( ~ lssmre ) to the most general setting in which such concepts make sense. Definition of Moore collection of sets in [Schechter] p. 78. A Moore collection may also be called a _closure system_ (Section 0.6 in [Gratzer] p. 23.) The name _Moore collection_ is after Eliakim Hastings Moore, who discussed these systems in Part I of [Moore] p. 53 to 76. See ~ ismre , ~ mresspw , ~ mre1cl and ~ mreintcl for the major properties of a Moore collection. Note that a Moore collection uniquely determines its base set ( ~ mreuni ); as such the disjoint union of all Moore collections is sometimes considered as ` U. ran Moore ` , justified by ~ mreunirn . (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Jan-2015.) (Revised by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)

blocks.name: df-mrc
blocks.content: Define the _Moore closure_ of a generating set, which is the smallest closed set containing all generating elements. Definition of Moore closure in [Schechter] p. 79. This generalizes topological closure ( ~ mrccls ) and linear span ( ~ mrclsp ). A Moore closure operation ` N ` is (1) extensive, i.e., ` x C_ ( N `` x ) ` for all subsets ` x ` of the base set ( ~ mrcssid ), (2) isotone, i.e., ` x C_ y ` implies that ` ( N `` x ) C_ ( N `` y ) ` for all subsets ` x ` and ` y ` of the base set ( ~ mrcss ), and (3) idempotent, i.e., ` ( N `` ( N `` x ) ) = ( N `` x ) ` for all subsets ` x ` of the base set ( ~ mrcidm .) Operators satisfying these three properties are in bijective correspondence with Moore collections, so these properties may be used to give an alternate characterization of a Moore collection by providing a closure operation ` N ` on the set of subsets of a given base set which satisfies (1), (2), and (3); the closed sets can be recovered as those sets which equal their closures (Section 4.5 in [Schechter] p. 82.) (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Jan-2015.) (Revised by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)

blocks.name: df-mri
blocks.content: In a Moore system, a set is _independent_ if no element of the set is in the closure of the set with the element removed (Section 0.6 in [Gratzer] p. 27; Definition 4.1.1 in [FaureFrolicher] p. 83.) ` mrInd ` is a class function which takes a Moore system to its set of independent sets. (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)

blocks.name: df-acs
blocks.content: An important subclass of Moore systems are those which can be interpreted as closure under some collection of operators of finite arity (the collection itself is not required to be finite). These are termed _algebraic closure systems_; similar to definition (A) of an algebraic closure system in [Schechter] p. 84, but to avoid the complexity of an arbitrary mixed collection of functions of various arities (especially if the axiom of infinity ~ omex is to be avoided), we consider a single function defined on finite sets instead. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: fnmre
blocks.content: The Moore collection generator is a well-behaved function. Analogue for Moore collections of ~ fntopon for topologies. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: mresspw
blocks.content: A Moore collection is a subset of the power of the base set; each closed subset of the system is actually a subset of the base. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: mress
blocks.content: A Moore-closed subset is a subset. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: mre1cl
blocks.content: In any Moore collection the base set is closed. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: mreintcl
blocks.content: A nonempty collection of closed sets has a closed intersection. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mreintcl(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls)), wcel(cint(c2), c0))

  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls)), wcel(cint(c2), c0), wcel(c2, cpw(c0)), wral(hs0, cpw(c0), wi(wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wcel(cint(cv(hs0)), c0))), wne(c2, emptycls))

  biimpar(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wcel(c2, cpw(c0)))
  elpw2g(c0, cfv(cmre, c1), c2)

  simp3bi(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wral(hs0, cpw(c0), wi(wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wcel(cint(cv(hs0)), c0))), wss(c0, cpw(c1)), wcel(c1, c0))
  ismre(hs0, c0, c1)
  simp3(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls))
  3impia(wcel(c2, cpw(c0)), wral(hs0, cpw(c0), wi(wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wcel(cint(cv(hs0)), c0))), wne(c2, emptycls), wcel(cint(c2), c0))
  rspcva(hs0, c2, cpw(c0), wi(wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wcel(cint(cv(hs0)), c0)), wi(wne(c2, emptycls), wcel(cint(c2), c0)))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wcel(cint(cv(hs0)), c0), wne(c2, emptycls), wcel(cint(c2), c0))
  neeq1(cv(hs0), c2, emptycls)

  3impia(c2 ‚àà P(c0), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà P(c0),(hs0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚Üí ‚ãÇ hs0 ‚àà c0)), c2 ‚â† ‚àÖ, ‚ãÇ c2 ‚àà c0)
  rspcva(hs0, c2, P(c0), (hs0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚Üí ‚ãÇ hs0 ‚àà c0), (c2 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚Üí ‚ãÇ c2 ‚àà c0))

  simp1(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wne(c2, emptycls), wral(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0)))
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wne(c2, emptycls), wral(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0)), wss(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), c0))

  3adant1(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wne(c2, emptycls), wral(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0)), wne(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), emptycls))
  imp(wne(c2, emptycls), wral(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0)), wne(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), emptycls))
  sylbi(wne(c2, emptycls), wi(wral(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0)), wne(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), emptycls)), wex(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c2)))
  n0(s0, c2)
  exlimi(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c2), wi(wral(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0)), wne(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), emptycls)))
  nfim(s0, wral(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0)), wne(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), emptycls))
  nfra1(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0))
  nfne(s0, cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), emptycls)
  nfab(s0, hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3)))
  nfre1(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))
  nfcv(s0, emptycls)
  syl6ibr(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wral(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0)), wne(cab(hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), emptycls), wex(hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))))
  syld(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wral(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0)), wex(hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), wcel(c3, c0))
  com12(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wral(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0)), wcel(c3, c0))
  rsp(s0, c2, wcel(c3, c0))
  syl6ib(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(c3, c0), wex(hs0, wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), wrex(s0, c2, wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))))
  syl5(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(c3, c0), wrex(s0, c2, wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))), wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c3)))
  elisset(hs0, c3, c0)
  ex(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c3)), wrex(s0, c2, wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c3))))
  rspe(s0, c2, wex(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), c3)))

  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)

blocks.name: mrerintcl
blocks.content: The relative intersection of a set of closed sets is closed. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 3-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mrerintcl(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0)), wcel(cin(c1, cint(c2)), c0))
} = {
  pm2.61dane(c2, emptycls, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0)), wcel(cin(c1, cint(c2)), c0))
  eqeltrd(cin(c1, cint(c2)), c0, c1, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0)), wceq(c2, emptycls)))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0)), wceq(c2, emptycls), wceq(cin(c1, cint(c2)), c1))
  rint0(c2, c1)
  ad2antrr(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wceq(c2, emptycls), wcel(c1, c0))
  mre1cl(c0, c1)
  3expa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls), wcel(cin(c1, cint(c2)), c0))
  eqeltrd(cin(c1, cint(c2)), c0, cint(c2), w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls)))
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls)), wceq(cin(c1, cint(c2)), cint(c2)), wss(c2, cpw(c1)), wne(c2, emptycls))
  sstrd(c2, cpw(c1), c0, w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls)))
  simp2(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls), wss(c0, cpw(c1)))
  mresspw(c0, c1)
  simp3(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls))
  rintn0(c2, c1)
  mreintcl(c0, c1, c2)
}

blocks.name: mreuni
blocks.content: Since the entire base set of a Moore collection is the greatest element of it, the base set can be recovered from a Moore collection by set union. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: mreunirn
blocks.content: Two ways to express the notion of being a Moore collection on an unspecified base. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Jan-2015.)

  diff.hs0.c(universe)

blocks.name: ismred
blocks.content: Properties that determine a Moore collection. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Jan-2015.)

thm ismred(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c0, cpw(c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c0))
  -| wi(w3a(w0, wss(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), emptycls)), wcel(cint(cv(s0)), c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  syl3anbrc(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(c0, cpw(c1)), wcel(c1, c0), wral(s0, cpw(c0), wi(wne(cv(s0), emptycls), wcel(cint(cv(s0)), c0))))
  ralrimiva(s0, cpw(c0), w0, wi(wne(cv(s0), emptycls), wcel(cint(cv(s0)), c0)))
  sylan2b(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c0)), wi(wne(cv(s0), emptycls), wcel(cint(cv(s0)), c0)), wss(cv(s0), c0))
  selpw(s0, c0)
  3expia(w0, wss(cv(s0), c0), wne(cv(s0), emptycls), wcel(cint(cv(s0)), c0))
  ismre(s0, c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: mremre

blocks.name: submre
blocks.content: The subcollection of a closed set system below a given closed set is itself a closed set system. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 9-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm submre(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(cin(c0, cpw(c2)), cfv(cmre, c2)))
} = {
  ismred(hs0, cin(c0, cpw(c2)), c2, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(cin(c0, cpw(c2)), cpw(c2)))
  elind(c2, c0, cpw(c2), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c2, c0))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c2, cpw(c2)))
  pwidg(c2, c0)
  elind(cint(cv(hs0)), c0, cpw(c2), w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(cv(hs0), cin(c0, cpw(c2))), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls)))
  syl3anc(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(cv(hs0), cin(c0, cpw(c2))), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls)), wcel(cint(cv(hs0)), c0), wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls))
  simp1l(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wss(cv(hs0), cin(c0, cpw(c2))), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls))
  3ad2ant2(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(cv(hs0), cin(c0, cpw(c2))), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wss(cv(hs0), c0))
  mpan2(wss(cv(hs0), cin(c0, cpw(c2))), wss(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cin(c0, cpw(c2)), c0))
  inss1(c0, cpw(c2))
  sstr(cv(hs0), cin(c0, cpw(c2)), c0)
  mreintcl(c0, c1, cv(hs0))

  syl6sseq(cint(cv(hs0)), c2, cuni(cpw(c2)), w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wss(cv(hs0), cin(c0, cpw(c2))), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls)))
